intro: Storckiella pancheri subsp. acuta, commonly known as the acute storckiella, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically narrow and elongated, with a slightly hairy surface. This subspecies is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
